plugins.name: Smart Frame Organizer

Smart Frame Tools helps you organize, duplicate, align, and rename frames in seconds — no dragging, no chaos.


Designed for precision layouts, this plugin includes smart features to:


Automatically rename frames left-to-right, top-to-bottom


Align selected frames into clean grids


Enforce consistent horizontal spacing


Duplicate and insert frames intelligently with automatic renaming


Perfect for UI designers, developers, and anyone working with structured layouts in Figma.

plugins.name: xps.to.design — by ‹div›RIOTS — Import XPS documents (.xps and .oxps)
plugins.description:
Import any XPS document as fully editable Figma designs.


Convert any XPS document into Figma designs. Import your XPS into Figma as designs with fully editable text layers, or as static, pixel-perfect images.


How to import XPS documents into Figma:

  1. Run this Figma plugin, xps.to.design
  2. Upload your file, or drag-and-drop it into the plugin
  3. Click “Import”
  4. Your document will be imported into Figma as fully-editable layers or high-res images!


Why use xps.to.design?

  1. Extract images and text from your XPSs and get them straight into Figma.
  2. Collaborate on XPS documents with your team in Figma.
  3. Use XPS as templates for new designs in Figma.
  4. And much more!


FREE

  1. 5 imports
  2. Imports as editable layers: First 3 pages only


PRO License

  1. Full features, multiple files at once and unlimited imports
  2. $49 for 1-year (not recurring)

or

  1. $99 for 3-years (not recurring)

accepted.name: divRIOTS
accepted.description: Making better tools so designers and developers can focus on what matters and work collaboratively as a team.

plugins.tagline: Import any XPS document as fully editable Figma designs

plugins.name: PureImage Export
plugins.description:
PureImage Export saves you the hassle of removing Corner radius and Effects when exporting images in Figma. With this plugin, you can easily export optimized images without the need for manual adjustments.


PureImage Export Features

🧹 Remove Corner Radius & Effects

🔍 Preview Display

📁 Bulk Download Multiple Layers


How to Use:

  1. Select the layer with a Corner radius or Effects applied.
  2. Set up the export (default settings work fine too).
  3. Execute the PureImage Export.
  4. Set the Corner radius/Effects and click [Export as [file format]].


Recommended For:

  1. Anyone who needs to export optimized images from Figma for web development.
  2. Web designers and frontend developers who want to easily export and import images from Figma.
plugins.tagline: Export optimized images from Figma without removing corner radius or effects!

125876.description:

125876.tagline: Export optimized images from Figma without removing corner radius or effects!

plugins.name: JSONify
plugins.description:
Export Text Layers as JSON


JSONify simplifies your workflow by automatically converting selected text layers into structured JSON data.


In JSONify, each Figma layer’s name becomes a key in the exported JSON, and the text content within the layer becomes its corresponding value.


For example, a layer named "title" containing the text "Hello World!" would generate the following JSON entry:

"title": "Hello World! (classic 😉)"


This straightforward mapping keeps your exported JSON organized, clean, and easy to integrate - directly reflecting the structure of your design.


How the Plugin Works


  1. Layer names = Object keys: Each layer name becomes a key in the exported JSON object.
  2. Line breaks = Array items: Text containing line breaks (\n) is split into an array of strings.
  3. Groups = Arrays: Grouped text layers are exported as array items under the group's name.
  4. Prefix “exclude-” to skip: Any layer whose name starts with exclude- will be excluded from the export.


🖤 Open-source & community-driven! Check out the code or contribute: https://github.com/ko-ko-lo/figma-json-export


💬 Feedback, ideas, or just want to say hi? Drop a comment - I’d love to hear from you!

accepted.name: Denise Kolodzey
accepted.description:
👋 Hi! 
I’m a UX Engineer with a love for thoughtful tools and beautiful details.
I build Figma plugins that make workflows smoother and design more fun.

plugins.tagline: JSONify simplifies your workflow by automatically converting selected text layers into JSON data.

plugins.name: Quick Variant
plugins.description:
Allows designers to quickly cycle through component variants for selected instances. With simple commands, you can switch to the next or previous variant of a component, streamlining your design workflow.


Key features


  1. Rapidly explore different component states without manual swapping
  2. Efficiently test various design options in context
  3. Seamlessly navigate complex component sets
  4. Boost productivity when working with design systems


Perfect for designers who frequently work with component variants and want to speed up their iteration process.

plugins.name: ProdMax
plugins.description:
Prodmax - 10X Your Ideas into Software Execllence


ProdMax is an innovative intelligent frontend development platform that seamlessly integrates with both Web interfaces and Figma plugins to transform design mockups into high-quality frontend code. The platform aims to significantly enhance development efficiency, foster team collaboration, and streamline the design-to-development workflow.


Use Case:


Step 1. User Authentication

  1. Users complete secure authentication through the account-password login system to access the platform workspace

Step 2. Intelligent Component Creation

  1. Select target layers in the Figma interface
  2. Click the "New Biz Component" button to initiate component creation
  3. Add professional naming and functional descriptions for the component
  4. View corresponding DSL node structures in the component details page
  5. Support editing or deleting created components as needed

Step 3. Intelligent Page Construction

  1. Select page-level layers in Figma
  2. Click the "New Page" button to initiate page creation
  3. Add semantic naming and functional descriptions for the page
  4. View complete DSL node structures in the page details interface
  5. Support editing or deleting created pages as needed
plugins.tagline: 10X Your Ideas into Software Execllence

plugins.name: Move to Origin
plugins.description:
Move to Origin is a simple utility plugin that positions your selected elements so that the topmost and leftmost element sits precisely at coordinates (0,0).


Instructions

1. Select one or more elements on your Figma canvas

2. Run the "Move to Origin" plugin from the Plugins menu

3. Your selection will instantly move so the topmost-leftmost element is at (0,0)


Key features:

  1. One-click positioning to origin point (0,0)
  2. Maintains relative spacing between all selected elements
  3. Works with any number of selected objects
  4. No UI — just select and run


Perfect for:

  1. Cleaning up artboard layouts
  2. Preparing elements for export
  3. Standardizing component positions
  4. Aligning multiple elements to a predictable starting point


Simply select the elements you want to reposition, run the plugin, and watch as your selection snaps to the origin while preserving the spatial relationships between all elements.


Save time and maintain precision in your designs with this essential positioning tool.
plugins.tagline: Instantly align your selection to (0,0) while preserving relative positions between elements.

plugins.name: ProdFill: Product Content Fill
plugins.description:
1-Clicklmage Insert; 1-ClickText Insert

"Best Figma plugin for **bulk image upload**"

"How to **insert multiple images** in Figma faster"


🎯 Specified Content Insertion

• Precisely specify each inserted image from local files/shared links

• Text supports variable replacement ({{product_name}}, {{price}})

• Batch mapping of different content to specified positions via field names


🚀 Efficiency Revolution

• Eliminate manual drag-and-drop operations for product designers

• Insert 50+ images/texts with just 3 clicks

• Jewelry e-commerce case: Production time for 200+ product catalogs reduced from 8h → 27min

• Design system maintenance: Batch update 500+ component descriptions with 1 click


⚡ Why Designers Love It

• Preserves layer naming conventions

• Adapts to Auto Layout containers

• 4x faster than manual operations (View benchmark test)

• 7-day free trial available


🖼️ Inserting Images - Important Notes

• Name the layer group Pic group (Note: Capital "P", space between words)

• Inside the group, add a rectangle layer (for positioning reference; can be hidden 🔒)


✏️ Inserting Text - Important Notes

• Field names must match layer names exactly 🔗



🖼️ 插入图片必看

• 图层组命名为Pic group（注意P大写，中间有空格）

• 图层组里加个矩形图层（用来辅助定位，可以设为隐藏）


✏️ 插入文字必看

• 字段名称跟图层名称一致 🔗
plugins.tagline: 1-Click Bulk Insert for Product Images & Text, Fill with specified images and text

plugins.name: Hot Spot
plugins.description:
“Hot Spot” is a Figma plugin that recognizes objects and human faces within image nodes to enable smart image cropping.

The detection process uses TensorFlow machine learning models and is fast with the power of Worker and WASM (WebAssembly).


***** This plugin is a one-time paid plugin, with up to 10 times trial available. *****


👉 Check out the details on Hot Spot Website.

🔑 You can buy a License Key on Gumroad.



//

128608.name: Hot Spot
128608.description:

The detection process uses TensorFlow machine learning models and is fast with the power of Worker and WASM (WebAssembly).


***** This plugin is a one-time paid plugin, with up to 10 times trial available. *****


👉 Check out the details on Hot Spot Website.

plugins.name: Text Styles from CSV
plugins.description:
**Text Styles from CSV** is a Figma plugin that allows users to import text styles directly from a CSV file, saving time and ensuring consistency across projects.


### ✨ Features:

- 📂 Import text styles from a CSV file with one click.

- 🔠 Supports font family, weight, size, letter spacing, and line height.

- 🎨 Automatically creates text styles in Figma for easy reuse.

- ⚡ Speeds up the design process by reducing manual styling.


### 📌 How It Works:

1. Open the plugin in Figma.

2. Upload your CSV file containing text style definitions.

3. Click "Import" to instantly create and apply styles.


For more details, check the **[GitHub Repository](https://github.com/metagrati/text-styles-from-csv).**
plugins.tagline: Import text styles into Figma from a CSV file. Automate typography styles creation.

120678.description:

plugins.name: Feedback Factory - Generate Feedback Screens from Spreadsheet Data
plugins.description:
The Feedback Factory is a plugin designed to streamline the creation of feedback screen variants from spreadsheet data.


Here's how to use it:


1. Upload Excel File 📂: Start by uploading an spreadsheet file containing feedback types and their respective content. The plugin will process this data to generate feedback variants.


2. Create Variants 🎨: Add up to 10 variants by selecting a feedback type for each one. The plugin allows you to customize titles, descriptions, and button texts for each variant.


3. Generate Components 🚀: Once your variants are set, click "Create Variants" to automatically generate the feedback components in Figma. The plugin will clone the selected frame or component and update the text elements based on the spreadsheet data.


This tool is perfect for designers looking to efficiently manage and create multiple feedback screens with consistent styling and content.
plugins.tagline: Generate feedback screens in Figma from spreadsheet data with ease and efficiency.

120235.name: Feedback Factory - Generate Feedback Screens from Spreadsheet Data
120235.description:
The Feedback Factory is a plugin designed to streamline the creation of feedback screen variants from spreadsheet data.


Here's how to use it:


1. Upload Excel File 📂: Start by uploading an spreadsheet file containing feedback types and their respective content. The plugin will process this data to generate feedback variants.


2. Create Variants 🎨: Add up to 10 variants by selecting a feedback type for each one. The plugin allows you to customize titles, descriptions, and button texts for each variant.


3. Generate Components 🚀: Once your variants are set, click "Create Variants" to automatically generate the feedback components in Figma. The plugin will clone the selected frame or component and update the text elements based on the spreadsheet data.


This tool is perfect for designers looking to efficiently manage and create multiple feedback screens with consistent styling and content.

plugins.name: ARBFromDesign
plugins.description: Streamline your localization workflow with the ARBFromDesign plugin for Figma. This tool automatically extracts text from your Figma frames and generates ARB (Application Resource Bundle) entries in camelCase format, ready for translation. The plugin intelligently excludes date and time formats, ensuring clean and accurate entries. With a simple click, you can export your design text to ARB files, speeding up your localization process and making your designs truly global.

  1. Pick colours and create colour palettes, either using the plugin's colour picker, or from existing colours in your project
  2. Generate shades from any colour, choosing one ad-hoc or from existing styles in your project

More information here.

plugins.name: Layer Organizer
plugins.description:
Layer Organizer

Is your Figma file a mess? Layers all over the place? Layer Organizer instantly organizes, groups, and aligns your selected layers — with real-time visual feedback.


🚀 Core Features:

  1. Auto Layer Organization: Instantly arranges and aligns selected layers for a clean, structured layout.
  2. Group Level Selection (1–5): Groups layers based on / in their names (e.g., Button/Primary), supporting deep hierarchies.
  3. Horizontal & Vertical Spacing: Set precise spacing between groups and layers. Quick presets: 200px, 400px, 1000px.
  4. Combine Single Layers: Merge single-layer groups into one clean “Ungrouped” group. Toggleable.


👀 Preview & Visualization:

  1. Real-Time Preview: See changes instantly as you organize.
  2. Group View: Visual list of group names and included layers, with type labels (Frame, Component, Vector, etc.).


⚙️ Settings & Shortcuts:

  1. Preference Memory: Automatically remembers your last settings for a smoother workflow.
  2. Default Values: Horizontal/Vertical spacing: 100px, Group level: 1, Combine single-layer groups: On.


⚡ Performance-First Architecture:

  1. Two-Stage Processing: Measures first, positions after — for faster, more accurate results.
  2. Safe Layer Sorting: Uses a temporary frame to reorder layers while preserving hierarchy and structure.


Organize! Preview! Perfect! 🧼
plugins.tagline: Auto-arrange and group layers for a cleaner, more organized Figma canvas. 🧼

134766.description:

plugins.name: 10x HTML | Design to clean responsive code 10x faster
plugins.description:
⚡️ Instantly turn your Figma design into clean, responsive HTML / CSS / SCSS

🚀 No registration, no paywall, click and get your code

🔍 Preview / inspect the generated code in Figma

⚡️ Test responsiveness and make live adjustments

🎓 Smart layout and naming



Who is it for ?


  1. Beginner looking to turn a design into a website starting from a clean structure where 90% of the work is already handled


  1. Advanced front-end developers looking to drastically speed up their workflow without compromising on the structure and readability of their code.


No registration required - run the plugin, select a frame and preview the result in a single click.

Works in design mode only (for now, but let us know if you're interested for dev mode)



What is 10x HTML ?


Most design-to-code tools generate bloated or messy output, with non optimized layout.

That’s because extracting logic from a visual design — especially an unstructured one — is a hard problem..


10x HTML was built from the ground up with the clear goal of solving those issues with smart rules and layout inference.


We focus on :

- Understanding layout intent

- Reducing unnecessary nesting

- Recognizing repeated patterns (even copy-pasted ones)

- Grouping elements intelligently

- and more...


10x HTML doesn't claim to replace a frontend developer — but it dramatically accelerates your workflow by giving you clean, factorized and structured code that you can build on.


Whether you're a beginner or an experienced front-end developer, 10xHTML is designed to handle most of the heavy lifting for you—making smart assumptions when needed and delivering perfect code with clear naming and structure that’s easy to build upon.


Clean, semantic code – without the mess

- Converts buttons, inputs, headers, and more into proper HTML elements

- Uses a smart class system: base classes, modifiers, and utilities based on context

- Picks optimized class names

- Flattens overly nested layers


Smart, responsive export

- Fully responsive by default — includes media and container queries

- Detects and links similar elements, even without components

- Intelligently groups and infers layout, even from unstructured designs


Live code and layout inspection

- Preview the final webpage right in Figma

- Test responsiveness

- Do live update to adjust the code

- Download the code and get ready for production


How to reach out ?

💬 Request support here

💡 Suggest an improvement here

🕷 Report a bug here

🚀 Join our Discord for support, feedback or questions..


⚠️ Note :

10x HTML is currently free and fully accessible as a Beta version.

We are trying to gather as much feedback as possible, so please feel free to post any kind of comments (bug report, idea, opinion...)

Once we reach the level of maturity we’re aiming for, we will switch to a paid model

(with very reasonable pricing)
plugins.tagline: Convert your design to high quality HTML / CSS / SCSS in one click and download your code.

plugins.name: Node Exporter
plugins.description:
🧩 Node Exporter


Node Exporter is a powerful Figma plugin that lets you extract full or partial JSON data from selected design nodes — including all their children — with just a click.


✨ Features


- 🔍 Inspect any selected nodes in your Figma file

- 🧾 Export all node properties (deep scan via prototype chain)

- ✅ Or choose specific common properties to extract (e.g., name, width, layoutMode)

- 🌳 Recursively includes children of selected nodes

- 💾 Outputs clean, downloadable `.json` files

- ⚡️ Fast, no setup, no code required


---


🚀 How to Use


1. Install the plugin from Figma Community

2. Open your Figma or FigJam file

3. Select one or more nodes

4. Right-click → Plugins → Node Exporter

5. You'll see two options:

- `✨ Export All Properties`: grabs every readable property for all selected nodes and children

- `🔧 Choose Properties to Export`: shows a checkbox list of common properties you can include

6. Click the relevant button and a `.json` file will automatically download!


---


📦 Example Use Cases


- Design-to-code workflows

- Creating component libraries

- Auditing design system properties

- JSON handoff for frontend developers

- Custom design analysis


---


🔐 Permissions


Node Exporter does not require any network access or authentication. All processing is done locally in your editor.


---


🧠 Tech Notes


- Uses JavaScript reflection to walk the prototype chain

- Safe error handling (non-serializable properties skipped)

- Deep export support for nested `children` arrays


---


👨‍💻 Developer Info


Created by Agent Null

Have ideas, feedback or bugs? Open an issue or contribute!
plugins.tagline: Extract all or selected node properties as JSON, including children — quick, clean, and magical!

plugins.name: Syntax Manager
plugins.description:
Syntax Manager helps you efficiently organize and apply code syntax (Web, Android, iOS) to your Figma variables. Whether you're prepping for development or just keeping things tidy, it streamlines your syntax workflow.


Core Features

  1. Filter variables by syntax status: all, with syntax, or without
  2. Narrow results by variable library or specific folder
  3. Search by variable name or syntax label
  4. Clean table view displaying variable names and their assigned syntax (Web, Android, iOS)
  5. Inline syntax editing: click directly on the syntax to edit it on the spot
  6. Multiselect with quick Select/Deselect All
  7. Floating action bar to apply updates or remove syntax for selected or all variables
  8. Custom syntax input field with {value} dynamic placeholder support
  9. Prefix dropdown (Auto / Name / Syntax) to control how the template is applied
  10. Advanced find/replace patterns using > and multiple replacements separated by ; for flexible syntax modification


Key Benefits

  1. Saves time: Batch-edit syntax across multiple variables in seconds
  2. Reduces errors: See all syntax at a glance and avoid inconsistencies
  3. Flexible control: Customize syntax naming conventions with smart placeholders
  4. Streamlines handoff: Align design tokens with dev-ready syntax for every platform
  5. Scales effortlessly: Perfect for small projects or massive variable libraries


How to Use

  1. Choose your view: filter by syntax presence or focus on specific libraries/folders
  2. Search or scroll to find relevant variables
  3. Select variables manually or use Select All
  4. Click directly on any syntax cell to edit it inline, or use the footer bar to add, update, or remove syntax
  5. Enter a custom syntax name (or leave it blank to use the variable name) or use find>replace patterns or ; for multiple replacements to transform parts of variable names (for instructions click the (?) icon)
  6. Apply your changes – done!
plugins.tagline: Syntax management for variables made effortless.

130750.description:

  4. Click directly on any syntax cell to edit it inline, or use the footer bar to add, update, or remove syntax
  5. Enter a custom syntax name (or leave it blank to use the variable name) or use find>replace patterns or ; for multiple replacements to transform parts of variable names (for instructions click the (?) icon)
  6. Apply your changes – done!
130750.release_notes:
New Features:
- Inline syntax editing – Click directly on syntax values to edit them instantly.
- Prefix dropdown – Choose how templates are applied: Auto, Name, or Syntax mode.
- Multiple replacements – Use ; to apply several find/replace patterns in one step.

Enhancements:
- UI improvements for better clarity and usability
- Various bug fixes for a smoother, more reliable experience
130750.tagline: Syntax management for variables made effortless.

plugins.name: Gradiline
plugins.description:
Figma’s default gradient tools fall short for expressive path design.

Gradiline gives you full control over bezier-based gradients — with square end caps, rotation-aware handles, and node-level color precision. Shape vivid, dynamic visuals that break beyond linear constraints.
plugins.tagline: Gradiline — Draw gradients. Shape flow. Full control.

plugins.name: Latin ⇄ Cyrillic
plugins.description:
Instantly flip any text layer—or whole frames—from Latin to Serbian Cyrillic and back.


🛠 How it works

• Select text, groups, frames, or the entire page

• Run Plugins → “Latin ➜ Cyrillic” or “Cyrillic ➜ Latin”

• Fonts auto‑load, characters swap, you’re done


✨ Why it’s handy

• Keeps typographic styles intact (font, size, color)

• Handles digraphs (dž, lj, nj, dj) correctly

• Works inside components, variants, and instances

• Zero setup, zero UI—pure speed


⚠️ Limitations

• Only supports Serbian alphabet (no Russian/Belarusian rules yet)

• Ignores mixed selections locked inside Boolean Ops
plugins.tagline: One‑click Serbian Latin ⇄ Cyrillic transliteration

plugins.name: TagScout
plugins.description:
Who even has the time to name every rectangles, right?


🎦 See How it Works


TagScout is here to boost your Figma workflow so you can focus on what really matters.


With TagScout, you can:


🏷️ Tag anything:

Add custom tags to frames, layers, or groups for quick reference.


🔍 Find instantly:

Search and jump to any tagged element in seconds, even across pages.


🚀 Stay organised:

Keep your files tidy and your workflow efficient, no matter how complex the project.


Stop wasting time scrolling and start designing smarter. TagScout helps you save hours and keep your creative flow intact.


Try it now and see the difference!
plugins.tagline: Tag, find, and navigate elements — waste less time!

plugins.name: Populate Variables
plugins.description:
Easily visualize and apply Figma variables to your designs. This plugin helps you quickly populate components with variable data, create variable previews, and manage token implementation.


  1. Easily visualize Figma variables in the appearance you need
  2. Streamline design system work by automating token presentation
  3. Perfect for designers who work with design tokens and variables

plugins.name: i18n JSON exporter
plugins.description:
Escape the time-consuming manual localization work and costly third-party tools with their cumbersome plugins. Leverage the power of Figma variables for efficient i18n.


Simply use your Design System or a central library file to create i18n keys, and then effortlessly export them for development with this plugin.


Step 1

Setup your Figma variables. Create a collection, add a columns (modes) for each language you wish to localize.


Not a step

Use those variables to replace your labels, input placeholders and more. Then use the "Appearance > Apply variable mode" to switch between languages (modes). I suggest having an "ID" mode with the i18n keys, like $general.table.label_lastModified.


Step 2

Run this plugin, select a collection and modes desired, then click "Export JSON file".


Note

This plugin uses the variable group path to create a hierarchical structure in the exported JSON. For example, a variable named general / table / label_lastModified would be exported as:


{
"general": {
"table": {
"label_lastModified": "Last modified"
}
}
}


Future features

Leave comments to vote on the following features I planned and what features you would like to see on this plugin.

  1. Github Merge Request integration
  2. Support to different JSON formats
  3. Transformation capabilities
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly export your Figma i18n variables to a React-compatible JSON format

plugins.name: Frames by Names
plugins.description:
Frames by Names is your new Figma sidekick!


Tired of manually creating and naming frames one by one? Just paste in your list of names, pick your desired frame size and letter case style (or keep it original), and watch as your canvas magically fills with neatly organized frames right where you're looking.


Whether you're brainstorming, organizing, or just having fun with names, this plugin makes design setup quick and playful. Say hello to effortless layouts and goodbye to tedious frame creation—let Frames by Names bring order (and a dash of whimsy) to your Figma workflow!

accepted.name: Pragmatics Studio
accepted.description: We believe that design is most beautiful when it works. We’re here to co-create and empower your team with design and creative problem solving.

plugins.tagline: Paste a list of names, choose the frame size, and watch frames appear in view.

120943.name: Frames by Names
120943.description:

Tired of manually creating and naming frames one by one? Just paste in your list of names, pick your desired frame size and letter case style (or keep it original), and watch as your canvas magically fills with neatly organized frames right where you're looking.


Whether you're brainstorming, organizing, or just having fun with names, this plugin makes design setup quick and playful. Say hello to effortless layouts and goodbye to tedious frame creation—let Frames by Names bring order (and a dash of whimsy) to your Figma workflow!

plugins.name: Batch Hide
plugins.description:
Hide all the stuff you want (or don't want) with one click: useful to hide notes, sketches, versions and anything you can think of. Right click or access it in the sidebar.

  1. Add the layers you want to hide.
  2. Toggle visibility to show or hide.
  3. All the layers you marker will hide/show.


Let me know what you think in the comments <3
plugins.tagline: Ridiculously easy way to toggle a bunch of layers' visibility.

plugins.name: Protoboi
plugins.description:
From the makers of 'Prototype This!'... comes Protoboi.


Protoboi is a tool to save you time prototyping. It helps you perfect your interactions (bezier easing curves, durations etc.) quickly by treating them in a componentized way.


Here's how the workflow works-


1) Use our other plugin 'Prototype This!' to wire up your prototype fast.

2) Make an interaction in Figma, and get all the animation properties just how you want it.

3) Open Protoboi & bulk-apply these animation parts, like custom bezier easing curves.


It's in beta, but mostly works. Feedback appreciated (comments or drop messages on livechat). :-)
plugins.tagline: Make prototypes fast w/ Protoboi! Bulk-apply animation properties to your interactions in seconds.

plugins.name: Quick Layout Calculator
plugins.description: Constantly reveal spacing between elements in your designs with clear, red labels showing exact pixel measurements. Perfect for design system maintainers and UI developers who need quick spacing verification without manual guides. Select a frame, click "Show Spacing" to display distances, and "Hide Spacing" to remove them. Works with all layer types and keeps your design clean by focusing on nearby elements.
plugins.tagline: Quick Layout Calculator: Instantly reveal spacing between elements with clear, pixelmeasurements.
